techmeme.title: FTX sells its remaining 15M Anthropic shares, netting $450M+ and taking its total haul to $1.3B from its original $500M investment, as legal costs pass $500M (Zack Abrams/The Block)
Zara plans to expand live shopping broadcasts in the UK, Europe, and the US between August and October 2024, testing a format that is wildly popular in China (Reuters)
Monzo reports £880M in FY 2023-24 revenue, up from £355.6M in 2022, a £15.4M pretax profit, up from a £116.3M loss in 2022, 9.7M users, and £11.2B in deposits (Aisha S Gani/Bloomberg)
A look at the uptick of AI-generated videos on TikTok featuring politicians in the UK; Ofcom says TikTok was the fastest growing news source in 2022 and 2023 (Marianna Spring/BBC)
A look at OP_CAT, the front-runner in Bitcoin's software upgrade debate that could add new features, from better coin custody to DeFi apps common on ETH and SOL (Olga Kharif/Bloomberg)
